title: Rubrix API fails logging data when NER score is null

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

milestone.title: v0.15.0
milestone.description: This Milestone manages the feature and fixes that will be included in release 0.15.0

body:
**Describe the bug**
It fails logging data to rubrix when NER score is null. I have deactivated the ent_score in the prediction entity in order to be able to log the records. 
**To Reproduce**
I am using concise concepts to run few shot learning NER. Due to missing keys in the vocabulary you can get empty scores reported by concise concepts. 

**Expected behavior**
It should log records although ner score is null. 


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.14


**Additional context**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValidationError                           Traceback (most recent call last)

title: fix(UI): remove selected metadata fields for sortable fields dropdown

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

title: [Sphinx theme] Docu theme change

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
This is a proposal.
Features not available in our current [rtd theme](https://sphinx-rtd-theme.readthedocs.io/en/stable/), but that we would like to have:
- right TOC for the page content
- dark/light mode
- copy code snippets
- grid cards for galleries, something like https://pradyunsg.me/furo/kitchen-sink/

proposed theme with these features: [furo](https://pradyunsg.me/furo/quickstart/) In general I like the styles/features it has out of the box: https://pradyunsg.me/furo/kitchen-sink/

We should evaluate first how much work this change implies.

@Amelie-V @leiyre Gallery of available themes: https://sphinx-themes.org/

title: docs(#1501): fix user management guide

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
Closes #1501 

Not sure what happened in the last commit from my side, this PR should fix it.

title: feat(#1435) Improve access to actions in filters dropddown
body:
closes #1435

This PR improves the scrollable filter selectors (metadata and sort) by allowing the overlapping of the second level selector and improving the height of the dropdown

title: reentrant error when start rubrix in docker

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Hello again. I'm trying to start rubrix in k8s, and at start in container i got error:

```
--- Logging error ---
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1029, in emit
    self.flush()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1009, in flush
    self.stream.flush()
RuntimeError: reentrant call inside <_io.BufferedWriter name='<stderr>'>

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1029, in emit
    self.flush()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1009, in flush
    self.stream.flush()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/arbiter.py", line 242, in handle_chld
    self.reap_workers()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/arbiter.py", line 533, in reap_workers
    os.WTERMSIG(status)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/glogging.py", line 261, in warning
    self.error_log.warning(msg, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1390, in warning
    self._log(WARNING, msg, args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1514, in _log
    self.handle(record)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1524, in handle
    self.callHandlers(record)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1586, in callHandlers
    hdlr.handle(record)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 894, in handle
    self.emit(record)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 1033, in emit
    self.handleError(record)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/logging/__init__.py", line 956, in handleError
    traceback.print_stack(frame, file=sys.stderr)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/traceback.py", line 190, in print_stack
    print_list(extract_stack(f, limit=limit), file=file)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/traceback.py", line 25, in print_list
    print(item, file=file, end="")
RuntimeError: reentrant call inside <_io.BufferedWriter name='<stderr>'>
Call stack:
  File "/usr/local/bin/gunicorn", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(run())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/wsgiapp.py", line 67, in run
    WSGIApplication("%(prog)s [OPTIONS] [APP_MODULE]").run()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/base.py", line 231, in run
    super().run()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/app/base.py", line 72, in run
    Arbiter(self).run()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/arbiter.py", line 211, in run
    self.manage_workers()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/arbiter.py", line 551, in manage_workers
    self.spawn_workers()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gunicorn/arbiter.py", line 622, in spawn_workers
```

          resources:
            limits:

title: chore(documentation): review docs concepts
body: Closes #1482

title: feat(client): rubrix listener
body:
The missing component for MLOPs:

Some examples of use:

```python
import time
from typing import List

import rubrix as rb

from rubrix import listener, RBListenerContext


@listener(
    dataset="other-dataset",
    query="status:Validated AND last_updated: [now-5m TO *]",  # we set a time-windows of 5 minutes
    condition=lambda query: 80 <= query.total <= 100,
)
def next_batch_iteration(records: List[rb.TokenClassificationRecord]):
    # Do something with the records
    pass


@listener(
    dataset="sst2_listener",
    query="status:Validated AND (NOT _exists_:metadata.pending_update)",
    condition=lambda query: query.total > 0,
)
def update_external_db(
    records: List[rb.TextClassificationRecord], ctx: RBListenerContext
):
    for record in records:
        # update a mongo db or something else
        record.metadata["pending_update"] = False
    rb.log(records, name=ctx.dataset)  # update received records


@listener(
    dataset="sst2_listener",
    metrics=["F1"],
    condition=lambda query, metrics: metrics.F1.f1_macro < 0.95,
    with_records=False,
    execution_interval_in_seconds=15,
)
def some_dataset_listener(
    ctx: RBListenerContext,
):  # include a cxt: RubrixListenerContext as param instead of name, query,...args
    print(f"The model is degrading the performance: {ctx.metrics.F1}")
    # send an alert
    # or launch a model re-training
    # or buy something in amazon

some_dataset_listener.start()
update_external_db.start()

try:
    while True:
        time.sleep(1)
except KeyboardInterrupt:
    some_dataset_listener.stop()
    update_external_db.stop()
```

Waiting for your API use feedback before implementing the tests @dvsrepo @dcfidalgo

title: fix(#1503): Count filter values when loading a dataset with a route query
body:
fix #1503
This PR includes the route query filters for the filter counter calculation

title: [Read datasets/pandas] Add record ids by default
body:
This suggestion is "inspired" by the issue found in recognai/rubrix#1487 .

I propose to automatically add `id`s to the records when using the `rb.read_*` methods (which are basically the `rb.Dataset*.from_*` methods) to reflect the order of the records in the original `Dataset`/`DataFrame` object. Of course, if there is an `id` column, then it takes precedence over the default.

In this way, the order of the records when logging/loading them from Rubrix will, by default, be the same as in the "source".

CC @frascuchon

title: Password encryption method

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
I've noticed that in your documentation not indicated that password should be encrypted in bcrypt.

In your doc indicated this command:
https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/blob/master/docs/getting_started/user-management.ipynb?short_path=8a69e9b#L112

Despite the fact that you double use small `b` flag, in fact it should be `B` ( that means bcrypt encryption flag)
```
➜  ~ htpasswd --help
...
 -b  Use the password from the command line rather than prompting for it.
 -B  Force bcrypt encryption of the password (very secure).
```

At first time, i just copied command for htpasswd and i catch error `hash could not be identified`

It would be great if you specify in docs encryption method. Thanks.

However, when trying to log the record I receive the same error that the limit is 10000, as opposed to the new limit that I sent in the put request.

**ERROR**

opensearchpy.helpers.errors.BulkIndexError: ('1 document(s) failed to index.', [{'index': {'_index': '.rubrix.dataset.coreyelowsky.test.records-v0', '_type': '_doc', '_id': '2091e6a3-2daa-4f5b-8677-1adbe2254fd6', 'status': 400, 'error': {'type': 'mapper_parsing_exception', 'reason': 'The number of nested documents has exceeded the allowed limit of [10000]. body:
I'm trying to deploy rubrix in k8s and connect with external ES instance. Connection should be secure, but i got error

`opensearchpy.exceptions.SSLError: ConnectionError([SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: unable to get local issuer certificate (_ssl.c:1091)) caused by: SSLError([SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: unable to get local issuer certificate (_ssl.c:1091))`

This is because with opensearchpy you should select path in parametr `ca_certs` with `OpenSearch` function. Reference: https://opensearch.org/docs/latest/clients/python/#sample-code

It would be great if you add `ca_cert_path` variable to rubrix. #1495

title: Separate progress metrics and stats in the UI sidebar

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

labels.name: area: ux
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Experience (UX)

labels.name: team: frontend
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the frontend team

body:
Writing the web app references I found it difficult to explain how the Progress and Stats metric worked. I propose to have separate symbols for *Annotation progress* and *Overall rule metrics*. The latter symbol is only visible if the *Define rules* mode is available. All metrics would be available in each mode.

We could also separate *Mentions* and *Keywords* into two different Symbols giving them more meaningful names than *Stats*. The *Mentions* symbol would only appear for token classification datasets.

CC @Amelie-V

This is the first PR of a set of PRs resolving the issue #1432 

I will split the work into several PRs for the sake of the revision work. Finally, I will keep new API endpoints in the current API version, since otherwise, it will require extra work that we cannot tackle now.

The work included in this PR refers to a new API endpoint (server-side) for explicit dataset creation. Remember that the only way to create datasets in the current API is by using the **log records** endpoint.

title: [Annotation agent] Agent is not changed when validating records with annotation but `default` status

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

milestone.title: v0.15.0
milestone.description: This Milestone manages the feature and fixes that will be included in release 0.15.0

body:
**Describe the bug**
I have not reproduced this myself, so this should be tested. It was raised yesterday during a session with one of our production users.

The workflow:

- They created text classification records with both annotation and prediction and status = Default.
- In this way, it's easy for the annotators to just validate those records that are already labeled correctly.
- Users validate records (they actually review ~3000 per week). 
- The issue is that only records for which they change the annotation get assigned the annotation_agent. For those `validated` by accepting the annotations, the `annotation_agent` is still the `machine_process` agent.

I think the proper way would be to change the annotation_agent even if no annotation was modified as the user is confirming they agree with the annotation so the record is manually annotated.

**To Reproduce**
Not possible on my side today

title: chore: using manual version system

labels.name: area: ci
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Continuous Integration (CI)

body:
The automatic package `setuptools-scm` system is nice for continuous development but does not fit well if we have several branches and releases, since generated versions depend on which git local info has the builder 

So, the idea here is just to define the version manually. We can control the version control and use it in the development of new features (what can be effective for compatibility features)

body:
Fixes #1428 

With this PR we support cleanlab v1 and v2. There is an issue with our default sorting method and multi-label records (https://github.com/cleanlab/cleanlab/issues/243), so for now we choose a different method when using cleanlab v2 + multi-label records.

title: [Dropdown height limitation] - Improve access to actions : Filter/Sort/Cancel/remove

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

milestone.title: v0.15.0
milestone.description: This Milestone manages the feature and fixes that will be included in release 0.15.0

body:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes, especially with metadata dropdown list are very long and it's complicated to access to button action.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'metadata filter'
2. Click on 'Select option into a metadata' at the bottom of your screen
3. Scroll down to access to Filter/cancel ....
4. See how it's long to access

**Expected behavior**
Avoid very long scroll to access to main actions.

- Dropdown level 2 Limit value number to 6 at first sight and then active scroll. 
- Dropdown level 1 Limit height to 70% screen size (approx)

eg:
First level: Metadata list
Second level: Option list for each metadata

- Fix action at the modal bottom: Filter/Sort/Cancel/remove all filters/_Only records not covered by rules_ checkbox


**Screenshots**
Video and SS

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]:
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]:
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]:
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

Closes #1430 

Removes the experimental tag from the docs for Text2Text records, as well as for the labeling and metrics module.
This PR also updates the url to the query guide.

title: feat(#1432): basic dataset settings

labels.name: status: wontfix
labels.description: Indicates that work won't continue on an issue or pull request

body:
This PR includes needed components to create a basic set of settings for token and text classification datasets.

The new required API endpoints are implemented as a new API version (v1). 

The client components are built in a different way. Now, the main API client contains child APIs (datasets API for now) that can be used for specific API communication. Also, the inner client wraps the `httpx` client, it's easier to use the client directly:

````python
self._client.post("/api/v1/datasets"....)
````

Closes #1432 

## Update

- A `rb.create_dataset` is provided
- The dataset settings models are found under the module `rubrix.datasets`
- Settings can only be provided on dataset creation
- No way to fetch already configured dataset settings 

A simple code snippet:

```python
import rubrix as rb
from rubrix.datasets import TextClassificationSettings

settings = TextClassificationSettings(labels_schema={ "Positive", "Negative" })
rb.create_dataset(name="a-new-dataset", settings=settings)
...
rb.log(name="a-new-dataset", records....)
```

## TODOs

- [ ] The settings documentation part
- [ ] A place in guides
- [ ] Check provided annotations in records when log records against labels schema (new API)
- [ ] Allow read settings from UI

title: labeling module fails with cleanlab 2.0

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
The `cleanlab.pruning` module does not exist anymore in 2.0 version. See [migration doc](https://docs.cleanlab.ai/master/migrating/migrate_v2.html) for more details.

We should either support both versions or limit them to 1.0 issuing an error if the installed version is not compatible

title: refactor: change server module structure
body:
This PR includes a lot of changes, but the main idea is the new Rubrix `server` modules structure  as follows:

- `apis`: The APIs modules definition. This module contains all API models and handlers for each API version (current is v0)
- `daos`: DAO implementations for datasets and records
- `elasticsearch`: elasticseach-related operation modules: query builder, mappings, client wrapper...
- `errors`: server errors definition. All server errors should be placed here
- `security`: the security stuff modules
- `services`: The services layer modules that will be used by APIs 

As for missing work, we must define per-layer data models. For now, data models are shared by API and services layer, but each layer should have its own models. Anyway, This will be tackled in a separate PR.

If the new structure is ok for you, we can merge this PR (if CI is passing)

title: Refactor to `rb.DatasetFor*` by default
body:
Fixes #1360 

1. Remove `as_pandas` argument in the `rb.load` method, return a `rb.DatasetFor*` by default
2. Return `rb.DatasetFor*` objects instead of records `list`s in the `labeling` module

Regarding the first requirement above, I was wondering if could you maybe have a look, to make sure that the fix is correct. If not, could you maybe suggest some changes? 

Regarding the second requirement, could you maybe provide a hint in terms of how to cast from `List[TextClassificationRecord]` to `Dataset`? (assuming that `Dataset` is indeed `rb.DatasetFor*`)

body: TokenClassificationRecord - if two consecutive words are identical, the white space separating the words is ignored when uploaded. I wonder if this is related to issue #1383.
